thread.title: Liverpool defender Joel Matip has no intention of Cameroon U-turn even after AFCON triumph
thread.title_full: Liverpool defender Joel Matip has no intention of Cameroon U-turn even after AFCON triumph

author: Darren Lewis
title: Liverpool defender Joel Matip has no intention of Cameroon U-turn even after AFCON triumph
text:
Matip has no intention of returning to action with Cameroon (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Liverpool defender Joel Matip has no intention of coming out of international retirement despite Cameroon’s Africa Cup of Nations victory. 
Indomidable Lions boss Hugo Broos has taunted Matip who controversially claimed before the competition that he had retired from international football and had no desire to represent his country. 
Instead Matip has remained with Liverpool who have endured a nightmare run of form and are now out of the top four. 
Broos said: “There was a lot of trouble before, players who wouldn’t come with us,” said Broos after the final. Cameroon took the title in Gabon (Photo: REUTERS) Cameroon chief Hugo Broos (Photo: AFP) 
“OK, it’s their decision. But maybe they are saying now to themselves, ‘S***! Why didn’t I go with them?’ 
“We came here and I think nobody thought we would go so far.” 
Cameroon came from behind to beat Egypt 2-1 in the final, with Vincent Aboukakar scoring an 88th-minute winner. Matip remained with Liverpool having quit the international scene (Photo: Julian Finney) 
Matip, 25, last played for his country in an AFCON qualifier in September 2015 and rejected a call-up to Broos’ squad for the tournament in Gabon. 
He is understood to be adamant that his position will not change despite his country’s success. 
The former Schalke centre-back was one of seven players to pull out of the provisional 35-man squad. Others included West Brom’s Allan Nyom. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
